tool.name: Local Realignment:
tool.command:
rgGATKLocalRealign.py --input "$input_file" -n "$out_prefix" --tmp_dir "${__new_file_path__}" -o "$out_realigned_bam" -d "$html_file.files_path" -t "$html_file" --isPaired "$isPaired" --gatkjar "${GALAXY_DATA_INDEX_DIR}/shared/jars/GenomeAnalysisTK.jar" --fixMatejar "${GALAXY_DATA_INDEX_DIR}/shared/jars/FixMateInformation.jar" #if $genomeSource.refGenomeSource=="history": --refseqfasta "$genomeSource.ownIndex" #else --refseqfasta "${ filter( lambda x: str( x[0] ) == str( $genomeSource.index ), $__app__.tool_data_tables[ 'all_fasta' ].get_fields() )[0][-1] }" #end if
#if $dSrc.refdbsnpSource=="history": --dbsnp_rod "$dSrc.ownFile" #end if #if $dSrc.refdbsnpSource=="indexed": --dbsnp_rod "${ filter( lambda x: str( x[0] ) == str( $dSrc.index ), $__app__.tool_data_tables[ 'dbsnp_rod' ].get_fields() )[0][-1] }"
"$dSrc.index" #end if #if $sSrc.snpsSource=="history": --snpcalls "$sSrc.ownFile" #end if #if $iSrc.indelSource=="history": --indelcalls "$iSrc.ownFile" #end if #if $tSrc.interSource=="history": --intervals "$tSrc.ownFile" #end if

param.name: input_file
param.label: Input: sam or bam format short read data in your current history
param.help: If the select list is empty, you need to upload or import some aligned short read data from a shared library

param.name: isPaired
param.label: Paired end or mate pair data - run Picard FixMatepair
param.help: If true, FixMate will be run as the final step as recommended - see GATK documentation

param.name: out_prefix
param.label: Title for the output file - use this remind you what the job was for

param.name: refGenomeSource
param.help: This tool needs a reference genome. Default is usually right
param.label: Align to which reference genome? - default, built-in or choose from current history
param.option: Default - use the input data genome/build
Use a genome (fasta format) from my history

validator.message: No reference build available for the selected input data

param.name: ownIndex
param.label: Select a reference genome from history

param.name: refdbsnpSource
param.help: If in doubt, choose built-in and read GATK documentation please
param.label: Known variant resource - none, built-in or from current history?
param.option: Use reference snp data from my history

param.name: ownFile
param.label: Select a dbsnp rod file from your history

param.name: snpsSource
param.help: If in doubt, choose No target SNPs and read GATK documentation please
param.label: Target SNP loci in vcf - none or from current history?
param.option: Use a vcf format set of target SNPs from my history

param.name: ownFile
param.label: Select a vcf target SNPs file from your history

param.name: indelSource
param.help: If in doubt, choose No indels and read GATK documentation please
param.label: Target insertion/deletion loci in vcf - none or from current history?
param.option: Use a vcf format set of target indels from my history

param.name: ownFile
param.label: Select a vcf target indel file from your history

param.name: interSource
param.help: If in doubt, choose no intervals and read GATK documentation please
param.label: restrict the search to a specific region or set of regions instead of the whole genome. None or bed file from current history?
param.option: Do not limit realignment to specific regions (see GATK documentation)
Use a bed format set of intervals from my history

param.name: ownFile
param.label: Select a bed interval file from your history

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Purpose**
Perform local short read sequencing realignment around indels
Please refer to the GATK documentation at http://www.broadinstitute.org/gsa/wiki/index.php/Local_realignment_around_indels and at http://www.broadinstitute.org/gsa/wiki/index.php/File:IndelRealignmentAlgorithm.png since that was used as the specification for this Galaxy wrapper. Please let the Galaxy developers know if there are any errors or corrections - we need all the help you can give.
**Why you might want to use this tool**
This tool provides a Galaxy interface to a procedure recommended at for realigning short read sequence data around insertion and deletion polymorphisms. Galaxy allows you to follow the recommended procedure and keep all your work is securely, sharably and reproducibly persisted in a web app instead of spread all overyour laptop/desktop and cellphone.
